intro: Dolichandrone smithii, commonly known as the Smith's dolichandrone, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive floral structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
